author: Kavita Upadhyay
text:
After two days of talks with the agitating Jats, the Rajasthan government has agreed to the demands of the community, Social Justice and Empowerment Minister Arun Chaturvedi said on Tuesday.

Earlier in the day, the agitators torched a train engine and vandalised a railway station in Bharatpur.

The district administration had imposed prohibitory orders in eastern Rajasthan to control the spread of Haryana’s Jat stir to areas in the State, including Bharatpur.

However, on Tuesday, even amid heavy deployment of police forces, the Paprera railway station was vandalised. The engine of a goods train was set ablaze near the Halek railway station, Bharatpur District Collector Rajiv Jain said.

“The police resorted to teargas shelling and firing in the air to disperse a mob on NH 11 [in Bharatpur],” Mr. Jain said.

The situation was brought under control by evening after the State government entered into talks with the agitators.

The agitators had demanded that the OBC Commission must be given the status of a statutory body, and that after the Bill on Jat reservation was passed in the Rajasthan Assembly, the State government must enter into talks with the committee formed under Union Minister Venkaiah Naidu’s chairmanship to take up their concerns at the Central level.
title: Rajasthan agrees to Jat demands
